Description: Type of metadata template; provide the same one for all items/rows.
The technology used to generate the data in this file.
Further qualification of dataType, which may be used to indicate the state of processing of the data, aggregation of the data, or presence of metadata.

Links an entity to data types that the entity represents/contains. This is closely tied to the assay property. For example, a file of dataType `genomicVariants` might have an assay value of `whole genome sequencing`.
Diagnosis for the individual given signs and symptoms. Use the most specific diagnosis term that applies.
Defined format of the data file, typically corresponding to extension, but sometimes indicating more general group of files produced by the same tool or software
A unique identifier (non-PII) that represents the individual from which the data came. This could be a patient or animal ID.
Library kit ID.
Method by which library was prepared
Strandedness of paired-end RNA-Sequencing data. This is an important parameter for RNA-seq analysis.
A sequencing platform, microscope, spectroscope/plate reader, or other platform for collecting data.
The type of resource being stored and annotated
The name of a species (typically a taxonomic group) of organism.
A unique identifier (non-PII) that represents the subspecimen (subsample) from which the data came,  e.g. an ID that distinguishes between different parts of the same parent tumor specimen.
Term that represents preservation of the sample before usage in, e.g. sequencing
The type of tumor that the biospecimen used to generate the data were collected from.
The name of the file.
A numeric value representing age of the individual. Use with `ageUnit`.
A time unit that can be used with a given age value, e.g. years.
A unique identifier (non-PII) that represents the aliquots used for e.g. replicate runs. This is linked to the specimenID.
URI to supplemental asset(s), e.g. QC reports or other auxiliary files to support the processing, analysis, or interpretation of the current entity.
Batch identifier, can be used in any context where added batch information is helpful, such as different sequencing runs or collection times.
Also known as cell barcode, this value can be added for single-cell experiments to identify data at the cell level.
A cell type is a distinct morphological or functional form of cell.
Brief free-text comments that may also be important to understanding the resource.
Procedure by which a biological specimen is dissociated into individual cells or a cell suspension
A free-text description of the experimental condition (e.g. 5 mM doxorubicin).
Technology used to perturb gene
Specific way in which a single gene was perturbed in a sample
The HUGO gene symbol for the gene that is perturbed.
Whether or not sample source is a cell line (Yes; No)
The general strategy by which the library was prepared
HEK293 (cell line), Minnesota5 (swine strain), DXL (poultry strain), RB51 (vaccine strain of Brucella abortus)
Genotype of NF1 gene in the biospecimen from which the data were derived, if known.
Genotype of NF2 gene in the biospecimen from which the data were derived, if known
Source of the extracted nucleic acid used in the experiment
A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues. An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.

A unique identifier (non-PII) that represents the parent specimen (sample) from which the data came from, e.g. the single parent tumor that was subsectioned into several samples.  The parentSpecimenID can be the same as specimenID when there is no subsectioning.
If available, the coverage statistic as output from bedtools coverage or samtools stats.
Number of base pairs (bp) sequenced for a read
The read of origin, Read 1 or Read 2
Sequencing run type.
Phenotypic expression of chromosomal makeup that defines a study subject as male, female, or other.
The targeted read depth prior to sequencing.
